name: rhapsodically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that expresses great enthusiasm about something: She told us rhapsodically about the new flavour of ice cream that she had just discovered. The candidate spoke rhapsodically about the strong community in which she had grown up and its effect on her political views.
in a way that relates to a rhapsody (= a piece of music that has no formal structure and expresses powerful feelings): After the slow section, the first movement drifted rhapsodically to a close. The symphony opens rhapsodically with soaring strings.
More examplesFewer examplesIt was one of those Christmas songs that rhapsodically lists all the Christmas cliches, from Santa to sleigh bells.The new restaurant was reviewed rhapsodically by the critics.It was a rhapsodically beautiful production of the ballet.
